Package smile.clustering.linkage Description

Cluster dissimilarity measures. An agglomerative hierarchical clustering builds the hierarchy from the individual elements by progressively merging clusters. The linkage criteria determines the distance between clusters (i.e. sets of observations) based on as a pairwise distance function between observations. Some commonly used linkage criteria are
  • Maximum or complete linkage clustering
  • Minimum or single-linkage clustering
  • Mean or average linkage clustering, or UPGMA
  • Unweighted Pair Group Method using Centroids, or UPCMA (also known as centroid linkage)
  • Weighted Pair Group Method with Arithmetic mean, or WPGMA.
  • Weighted Pair Group Method using Centroids, or WPGMC (also known as median linkage)
  • Ward's linkage
